case_title: Pak Leather Crafts Limited and others vs Al-Baraka Bank Pakistan Limited
appellant: Pak Leather Crafts Limited and others
key_issues: Whether the time consumed by a litigant in payment of cost for certified copies can be excluded under section 12(5) of the Limitation Act.
Interpretation of 'time requisite' under section 12 of the Limitation Act.
Applicability of subsection (5) of section 12 of the Limitation Act to Banking Courts.

section_12_limitation_act.pre_amendment: Excluded only time consumed by court officials in preparing certified copies.
section_12_limitation_act.post_amendment: Introduced subsection (5) to deem the time between application submission and intimation of readiness as 'time requisite'.

court_findings: Payment of cost is a prerequisite for processing applications for certified copies.
Time consumed by litigants in paying fees cannot be excluded under section 12(5).
Subsection (5) does not stop the limitation period upon mere filing of an application.

precedents_cited.case_name: Fateh Muhammad v. Malik Qadir Bakhsh
Mst. Jamila Khatoon v. Mst. Tajunnisa
Mian Muhammad Sabir v. Malik Muhammad Sadiq

conclusion: The appeal was dismissed as the time consumed by the appellants in paying the fee for certified copies could not be excluded under section 12(5) of the Limitation Act.
